comment.author: 42400804@N05
comment._content:
picture of destruction, makes me think of Wilfrid Owen

Bent double, like old beggars under sacks,
Knock-kneed, coughing like hags, we cursed through sludge,
Till on the haunting flares we turned our backs,
And towards our distant rest began to trudge.
Men marched asleep. Many had lost their boots,
But limped on, blood-shod. All went lame, all blind;
Drunk with fatigue; deaf even to the hoots
Of gas-shells dropping softly behind.

comment.author: 37247779@N07
comment._content: Thank you, Renira, for bringing Wilfrid Owen to my attention.

comment.author: 32063791@N00
comment._content: Je suis de Warneton, non loin d'Ypres. Les arbres tes qu'on les voit étaient appelés"cure-dents". Warneton a également été complètement détruit ainsi que les villages environnants.
